meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here, and I'm back with a review that's gonna make you go haywire!

I'm diving into the world of Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER, a game that's got everyone talking. Well, except for Slant Magazine, who seems to be stuck in neutral. More on that later.

First off, let's talk about the premise. I mean, who wouldn't want to explore the intersection of ancient PC technology and western anime fandom? It's like a love child between Tron and Cowboy Bebop! The world-building is top-notch, folks. You'll be hooked from the get-go.

Now, about those puzzles... I've got some good news and bad news. The bad news is that they can be a bit wonky at times. But the good news is that they're not so challenging that you'll want to pull your hair out (like Noisy Pixel did). It's a perfect balance of fun and frustration.

The characters, oh boy! They're as quirky as I am after a few too many energy drinks. You'll fall in love with ES88's hunt for the Golden Butterfly, and the soundtrack is pure magic. It's like someone poured a bottle of fairy dust into your ears!

Now, let's take a look at what our friends from the critics' circle have to say:

Slant Magazine thinks it's an "immense, far-reaching embarrassment" (ouch). RPG Fan felt unsatisfied after completing the game multiple times (bless their heart).

Noisy Pixel was left feeling a little disappointed due to poor handling of some areas. That's okay, Noisy – we all have our off days!

Shacknews loves it so much they want to spend more time in this world. Gamers Heroes agrees, saying it provides a fantastic futuristic experience.

GAMINGbible had issues with the puzzles and story length, but overall enjoyed their time with NEURODIVER.

And Checkpoint Gaming... well, they were underwhelmed (sorry, guys!).

So, what's the verdict? Well, I think you'll find that Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER is a wild ride filled with charm, wit, and plenty of futuristic fun. Just don't expect it to change your life – unless you're as easily impressed as I am.

That's Hippo Penny outta here! See you in the next review, folks!
